page.title: 18FARMING IN SUTTON IN ASH.
page.content: {INTERIEW WITH MR.R.CASTLE. Mr.Castle was born on a farm in 1953. His father had bought 60 acres to fatten livestock for the butchers shop which had been in the family for 200 years.Today the farm is used for experimental crops such as triticaley a rye and barley hybrid,but this year he plans to erect a 10,000 sq.ft. building where two men will rear 200 calves for slaughter.He is concerned about the use of chemicals and plans to grow organic cattle feed to improve the quality of the meat.He learnt about farming by working with his father but now has to keep up with scientific developments.Farming has changed a lot in his lifetime,it is more profitable and uses more machines He likes his work-he can see the results,but insecurity is a problem due to E.E.C.rule changes.
